00048   // Don't bother with empty keys

00052 
00053   pthread_rwlock_rdlock( &lskvs_rwlock);
00054   root = lskvs_kvs;
00055   pthread_rwlock_unlock( &lskvs_rwlock);
00056 
00057   for( p=root; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
00058     if( strcmp( p->k, k) == 0) {
00059       break;
00060     }
00061   }
00062 
00063   if( p == NULL) {
00064     //
00065     // Add a new list item
00066     //
00067     p = calloc( 1, sizeof( *p));
00068     if( p == NULL) {
00069       lslogging_log_message( "lskvs_set: out of memory for kv struct (%d bytes", sizeof( *p));
00070       exit( -1);

00081 
00082     // leave a little room to grow
00083     //

00085       p->vl = 32;

00088 
00089     p->v = calloc( p->vl, sizeof( *v));

00102     pthread_rwlock_init( &p->l, NULL);
00103 
00104     pthread_rwlock_wrlock( &lskvs_rwlock);
00105     p->next   = lskvs_kvs;
00106     lskvs_kvs = p;
00107     pthread_rwlock_unlock( &lskvs_rwlock);
00108   } else {
00109     //
00110     // Just update the value
00111     // Assume the database only sent us an update because
00112     // the old and new values are different
00113     //
00114     pthread_rwlock_wrlock( &(p->l));

00116       free( p->v);
